intro: Humiriastrum mapiriense, commonly known as the Mapiriense dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Humiriastrum mapiriense is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
